newsitem.title: UK: Union says believes BA crew voted for strike.
newsitem.headline: Union says believes BA crew voted for strike.

text.p: The Transport and General Workers Union (T&G) said on Wednesday it believed British Airways Plc cabin crew had voted to strike.

"All the indications are that the cabin crew community employed by British Airways have voted overwhelmingly for industrial action," T&G general secretary Bill Morris told BBC radio. The T&G is due to announce the result of the ballot at a news conference later on Wednesday.
The T&G is holding a news conference at 1000 GMT to announce the result of the ballot in a long-running dispute over pay.
In an effort to avoid possible disruption to services, British Airways has said it would employee others to replace striking employees.
Morris said over 70 percent of those balloted voted, and of these "a very, very clear majority" voted for action. "We want negotiations, and we want them now," he s said.
The British Airline Stewards and Stewardesses Association, a branch of the T&G, balloted 10,000 members over possible strike action.
The vote came after five months of talks between BA and the union broke down over the failure to agree on BA's proposals for pay restructuring.
The proposed deal would provide crew with higher pensionable pay, in return for efficiencies within the department and lower pay rates for new crew staff.
